Package io.github.cjstehno.ersatz

Class ErsatzServer

java.lang.Object
io.github.cjstehno.ersatz.ErsatzServer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable, AutoCloseable
public class ErsatzServer extends Object implements Closeable
The main entry point for configuring an Ersatz server, which allows configuring of the expectations and management of the server itself. This is the class that should be instantiated in unit tests.

The server will be started on an ephemeral port so as not to collide with itself or other server applications running in the test environment. In your tests, you can retrieve the server port or URL using the getPort() and getServerUrl() methods respectively.

Using the ErsatzServer follows the workflow:

  1. Create the ErsatzServer instance.
  2. Configure the expectations.
  3. Start the server
  4. Run your client tests against the server.
  5. Verify the expectations.
  6. Stop the server.

See the User Guide for more detailed information.

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description

    Creates a new Ersatz server instance with empty (default) configuration.

    ErsatzServer(Consumer<ServerConfig> consumer)
    Creates a new Ersatz server instance configured by the provided Consumer, which will have an instance of ServerConfig passed into it for server configuration.

    • expectations

      public ErsatzServer expectations(Consumer<Expectations> expects)
      Used to configure HTTP expectations on the server; the provided Consumer<Expectations> implementation will have an active Expectations object passed into it for configuring server interaction expectations.

      Calling this method when auto-start is enabled will start the server.

      Parameters:
      expects - the Consumer<Expectations> instance to perform the configuration
      Returns:
      a reference to this server

    • expects

      public Expectations expects()
      An alternate means of starting the expectation chain.

      Calling this method when auto-start is enabled will NOT start the server. Use one of the other expectation configuration method if auto-start functionality is desired.

      Returns:
      the reference to the Expectation configuration object

    • timeout

      public ServerConfig timeout(int value, TimeUnit units)
      Used to specify the server request timeout property value on the server.

      The IDLE_TIMEOUT, NO_REQUEST_TIMEOUT, REQUEST_PARSE_TIMEOUT, READ_TIMEOUT and WRITE_TIMEOUT are all configured to the same specified value.

      Parameters:
      value - the timeout value
      units - the units the timeout is specified with
      Returns:
      a reference to the server being configured

    • timeout

      public ServerConfig timeout(int value)
      Used to specify the server request timeout property value on the server (in seconds).

      The IDLE_TIMEOUT, NO_REQUEST_TIMEOUT, REQUEST_PARSE_TIMEOUT, READ_TIMEOUT and WRITE_TIMEOUT are all configured to the same specified value.

      Parameters:
      value - the timeout value
      Returns:
      a reference to the server being configured

    • start

      public ErsatzServer start()
      Used to start the HTTP server for test interactions. This method should be called after configuration of expectations and before the test interactions are executed against the server.
      Returns:
      a reference to this server

    • clearExpectations

      public void clearExpectations()
      Clears all configured expectations from the server. Does not affect global encoders or decoders.

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Used to stop the HTTP server. The server may be restarted after it has been stopped.

    • close

      public void close()
      An alias to the stop() method.
      Specified by:
      close in interface AutoCloseable
      Specified by:
      close in interface Closeable

    • verify

      public boolean verify(long timeout, TimeUnit unit)
      Used to verify that all of the expected request interactions were called the appropriate number of times. This method should be called after all test interactions have been performed. This is an optional step since generally you will also be receiving the expected response back from the server; however, this verification step can come in handy when simply needing to know that a request is actually called or not.
      Parameters:
      timeout - the timeout value
      unit - the timeout unit
      Returns:
      true if all call criteria were met during test execution.

    • verify

      public boolean verify(long timeout)
      Used to verify that all of the expected request interactions were called the appropriate number of times. This method should be called after all test interactions have been performed. This is an optional step since generally you will also be receiving the expected response back from the server; however, this verification step can come in handy when simply needing to know that a request is actually called or not.
      Parameters:
      timeout - the timeout value (in seconds)
      Returns:
      true if all call criteria were met during test execution.

    • verify

      public boolean verify()
      Used to verify that all of the expected request interactions were called the appropriate number of times. This method should be called after all test interactions have been performed. This is an optional step since generally you will also be receiving the expected response back from the server; however, this verification step can come in handy when simply needing to know that a request is actually called or not.
      Returns:
      true if all call criteria were met during test execution.
